intro: Halgania corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences of pink or white flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including mammals and insects. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Halgania corymbosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
